required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trial to Evaluate AB011 Injection in Patients With CLDN18.2-positive Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: An Open, Two-stage, Phase I Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Preliminary Efficacy of AB011 Injection in Patients With CLDN18.2-positive Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open, two-stage, phase I study to evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics and preliminary efficacy of AB011 injection in patients with CLDN18.2-positive advanced solid tumors.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is an open, two-stage, phase I study to evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics and preliminary efficacy of AB011 injection in patients with CLDN18.2-positive advanced solid tumors. The study is composed of two stages: stage I is for dose escalation and stage II is for dose expansion.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse events (AE) of single and multiple dose (according to NCI CTCAE 5.0)
primary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a subject, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of serious adverse events (SAE) of single and multiple dose (according to NCI CTCAE 5.0)
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event is any undesirable experience associated with the use of a medical product in a patient. The event is serious when the patient outcome is: Death; Life-threatening; Hospitalization (initial or prolonged); Disability or Permanent Damage; Congenital Anomaly/Birth Defect; Other Serious (Important Medical Events).

primary_outcome.measure: The incidence and case number of DLT (Dose Limiting Toxicity) during observation period
primary_outcome.description: DLT is short for Dose Limiting Toxicity. dose-limiting describes side effects of a drug or other treatment that are serious enough to prevent an increase in dose or level of that treatment.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 Cycle after the last participant is enrolled in dose expansion phase (Approximately 2 years)
primary_outcome.description: The RP2D will be determined during the dose expansion stage of the study. RP2D will be determined using available safety and efficacy data.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: Area Under Curve (AUC) with immunoanalytical method
secondary_outcome.description: AUC will be recorded from the PK serum samples collected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: plasma clearance rate (CL) with immunoanalytical method
secondary_outcome.description: CL will be recorded from the PK serum samples collected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: minimum concentration (Cmin) with immunoanalytical method
secondary_outcome.description: Cmin will be recorded from the PK serum samples collected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: maximum concentration (Cmax) with immunoanalytical method
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax will be recorded from the PK serum samples collected.
T1/2 will be recorded from the PK serum samples collected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: apparent volume of distribution (Vd) with immunoanalytical method
secondary_outcome.description: Vd will be recorded from the PK serum samples collected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy: objective response rate (ORR) per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST 1.1)
secondary_outcome.description: The ORR is defined as the proportion of subjects with complete or partial objective response based on RECIST V1.1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy: disease control rate (DCR) per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST 1.1)
secondary_outcome.description: The DCR is defined as the proportion of subjects with complete or partial objective response, or stable disease based on RECIST V1.1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy: duration of response (DOR) per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST 1.1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the date of the first response CR/PR (whichever is first recorded) to the date of radiographical progression/death or date of censoring, up to 8 months.
secondary_outcome.description: DOR is defined as the time from the date of the first response CR (complete remission)/PR (partial remission) (whichever is first recorded) to the date of radiographical progression/death or date of censoring.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy: progression free survival (PFS) per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST 1.1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from date of treatment start until the date of radiological disease progression or until death due to any cause, up to 8 months.
secondary_outcome.description: PFS is defined as the time from date of treatment start until the date of radiological disease progression or until death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy: overall survival (OS) per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST 1.1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the date of treatment start until the documented date of death from any cause, up to 12 months.
secondary_outcome.description: OS is defined as the time from the date of treatment start until the documented date of death from any causes.

arm_group.description: AB011 Injection treatment. This phase 1 trial will include two stages, a dose escalation stage and an expansion stage.

intervention.description: AB011 Injection with dose escalation stage of 1mg/kg up to 40mg/kg, as well as dose expansion stage with recommended dose level from dose escalation stage.
intervention.other_name: recombinant humanized anti-Claudin 18.2 monoclonal antibody injection
recombinant humanized anti-CLDN 18.2 monoclonal antibody injection
